author: Odeinoichus
title: La Cucaracha, La Cucaracha...
review:
Set #71013 Mariachi: Interesting that LEGO would create three 'Mexican' based characters and two of them are both called the exact same.

Compared to Series 2, this Mariachi band member is using a brand new acoustic guitar piece to play music, and is sporting the LEGO mustache piece instead of a facial print. He's dressed all in black with a single sided torso print showing a big silver belt buckle in the shape of an eagle, a red tie/kerchief around his neck and a fancy silver highlighted jacket, the silver detailing is included on his large hat.

Overall this is a lazy re-use of a name for a second character that can become part of a proper Mariachi band, the first member in Series 2 had the maracas, this one brings the guitar to the set, here's hoping the third member will have a saxaphone. Definitely recommended for his parts and guitar.

author: BrickbyBrickDFM
title: Favorite Minifigure - The Mariachi!
review:
In Collectable Minifigures Series 16 (CMS 16), the Mariachi minifigure stands out in his traditional black and silver traje de charro (suit/outfit). The details of the red bowtie and the silver embroidered like greca design on the torso and sombrero is what makes the minifigure stand out above the others in this series. The guitar and mustache complete the look of a real traditional Mariachi. This minifigure is my favorite because it is introducing and exposing others to Mexican traditional and culture that they might not otherwise get.   

The issue that I have with the CMS series is the cost per minifigure. I thought $3.99 was high, but now, they are costing $4.99.  To me, this a negative.  

Overall, this a great minifigure to owe. I have been trying to collect all the CMS minifigures that represent different cultures.
